name: Avoid JavaScript Functions with High Fan-Out (PHP)
description:
This rule searches for all JavaScript Functions with High Fan-Out. 
         The Fan-out of JavaScript Function is the number of other artifacts that are referred in it. 
         When computing the Fan-Out of an artifact, multiple accesses to the same component of an artifact are counted as one access.
         The threshold is a parameter and can be changed as per requirement.
output:
This report lists all JavaScript Functions with a High Fan-Out.
      
This QR provides the following information:
JavaScript Function full name.
rationale: If an artifact is referencing large number of artifacts, maintenance and evolution becomes difficult. This is because all the referenced artifacts need to be updated and\or retested.
remediation: Modify the source code to reduce the number of JavaScript Functions with a high Fan-Out.
sample:
<!--
JavaScriptFanOut.php
-->

         }

         }
         
         highFanOutOperation();
      </script>
      
   </body>
</html>
